verses.verse: Him that is weak <WG770> in the faith <WG4102> receive <WG4355> you, but not to doubtful <WG1261> disputations. <WG1253>
For one <WG3739> believes <WG4100> that he may eat <WG5315> all <WG3956> things: another, <WG3739> who <WG3588> is weak, <WG770> eats <WG2068> herbs. <WG3001>
Let not him that eats <WG2068> despise <WG1848> him that eats <WG2068> not; and let not him which eats <WG2068> not judge <WG2919> him that eats: <WG2068> for God <WG2316> has received <WG4355> him.

Who <WG5101> are <WG1488> you that judge <WG2919> another <WG245> man's <WG245> servant? <WG3610> to his own <WG2398> master <WG2962> he stands <WG4739> or <WG2228> falls. <WG4098> Yes, <WG235> he shall be held <WG2476> up: for God <WG2316> is able <WG1415> to make <WG2476> him stand. <WG2476>

One <WG3739> <WG3303> man esteems <WG2919> one day <WG2250> above <WG3844> another <WG3739>: another esteems <WG2919> every <WG3956> day <WG2250> alike. Let every <WG1538> man be fully <WG4135> persuaded <WG4135> in his own <WG2398> mind. <WG3563>

He that regards <WG5426> the day, <WG2250> regards <WG5426> it to the Lord; <WG2962> and he that regards <WG5426> not the day, <WG2250> to the Lord <WG2962> he does not regard <WG5426> it. He that eats, <WG2068> eats <WG2068> to the Lord, <WG2962> for he gives God <WG2316> thanks; <WG2168> and he that eats <WG2068> not, to the Lord <WG2962> he eats <WG2068> not, and gives God <WG2316> thanks. <WG2168>
For none <WG3762> of us lives <WG2198> to himself, <WG1438> and no <WG3762> man <WG3762> dies <WG599> to himself. <WG1438>

For whether <WG1437> <WG5037> we live, <WG2198> we live <WG2198> to the Lord; <WG2962> and whether <WG1437> <WG5037> we die, <WG599> we die <WG599> to the Lord: <WG2962> whether <WG1437> <WG5037> we live <WG2198> therefore, <WG3767> or <WG5037> die, <WG599> we are the Lord's. <WG2962>
For to this <WG5124> end Christ <WG5547> both <WG2532> died, <WG599> and rose, <WG450> and revived, <WG326> that he might be Lord <WG2961> both <WG2532> of the dead <WG3498> and living. <WG2198>

But why <WG5101> do you judge <WG2919> your brother? <WG80> or <WG2228> why <WG5101> do you set <WG1848> at <WG1848> nothing <WG1848> your brother? <WG80> for we shall all <WG3956> stand <WG3936> before <WG3936> the judgment <WG968> seat <WG968> of Christ. <WG5547>

For it is written, <WG1125> As I live, <WG2198> said <WG3004> the Lord, <WG2962> every <WG3956> knee <WG1119> shall bow <WG2578> to me, and every <WG3956> tongue <WG1100> shall confess <WG1843> to God. <WG2316>
So <WG686> then <WG686> every <WG1538> one of us shall give <WG1325> account <WG3056> of himself <WG1438> to God. <WG2316>

Let us not therefore <WG3767> judge <WG2919> one <WG240> another <WG240> any <WG3371> more: <WG2001> but judge <WG2919> this <WG5124> rather, <WG3123> that no <WG3361> man put <WG5087> a stumbling block <WG4348> or <WG2228> an occasion <WG4625> to fall <WG4625> in his brother's <WG80> way.

I know, <WG1492> and am persuaded <WG3982> by the Lord <WG2962> Jesus, <WG2424> that there is nothing <WG3762> unclean <WG2839> of itself: <WG1438> but to him that esteems <WG3049> any <WG5100> thing to be unclean, <WG2839> to him it is unclean. <WG2839>

But if <WG1487> your brother <WG80> be grieved <WG3076> with your meat, <WG1033> now <WG3765> walk <WG4043> you not charitably. <WG2596> <WG26> Destroy <WG622> not him with your meat, <WG1033> for whom <WG3739> Christ <WG5547> died. <WG599>
Let not then <WG3767> your <WG5216> good <WG18> be evil spoken <WG987> of:
For the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> is not meat <WG1035> and drink; <WG4213> but righteousness, <WG1343> and peace, <WG1515> and joy <WG5479> in the Holy <WG40> Ghost. <WG4151>
For he that in these <WG5125> things serves <WG1398> Christ <WG5547> is acceptable <WG2101> to God, <WG2316> and approved <WG1384> of men. <WG444>
Let us therefore <WG686> <WG3767> follow <WG1377> after <WG1377> the things which make for peace, <WG1515> and things with which one <WG240> may edify <WG3619> another. <WG240>

For meat <WG1033> destroy <WG2647> not the work <WG2041> of God. <WG2316> All <WG3956> things indeed <WG3303> are pure; <WG2513> but it is evil <WG2556> for that man <WG444> who <WG3588> eats <WG2068> with offense. <WG4348>

It is good <WG2570> neither <WG3361> to eat <WG5315> flesh, <WG2907> nor <WG3366> to drink <WG4095> wine, <WG3631> nor <WG3366> any <WG3362> thing whereby <WG1722> <WG3739> your brother <WG80> stumbles, <WG4350> or <WG2228> is offended, <WG4624> or <WG2228> is made <WG770> weak. <WG770>

Have <WG2192> you faith? <WG4102> have <WG2192> it to yourself <WG4572> before <WG1799> God. <WG2316> Happy <WG3107> is he that comdemns <WG2919> not himself <WG1438> in that thing which <WG3739> he allows. <WG1381>
And he that doubts <WG1252> is damned <WG2632> if <WG1437> he eat, <WG5315> because <WG3754> he eats <WG2068> not of faith: <WG4102> for whatever <WG3956> is not of faith <WG4102> is sin. <WG266>
